Class Code3a

  • java.lang.Object
    • Code3a

  • public class Code3a
extends java.lang.Object
    A list of TAC statements (Inst3a). Basically, 3 address code is a list of Inst3a objects. However, in any compiler, it is necessary to allocate some memory for constants of variable size. The most obvious example are string constants. In VSL it is the only constants which need memory allocation. The other constants are integers which are operands in arithmetic expression and have immediate addresses. Consequently, Code3a has two attributes: a list of 3a instructions and a list of Data3a for storing the string constants.
    Author:
    MLB
